decks.notes: This deck focuses on using a combination of control elements and the Gifts Ungiven engine to search for key cards and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck's goal is to efficiently control the game through counterspells like Force of Will and Mana Drain, while using cards like Brain Freeze and Underworld Breach to combo off and win the game. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional versatility and resilience in the control strategy. Through careful resource management and precise decision-making, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of disruption, removal spells, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares to maintain board control and counter the opponent's threats. The deck also includes efficient mana sources such as the Moxen and Wasteland to ramp up quickly. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a versatile companion that can provide additional value and recursion. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through careful resource management and strong synergy among its cards.

The focus of this deck is to disrupt opponents with hatebear creatures like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex, while also using aggro creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Clarion Conqueror to quickly pressure them. The deck utilizes Cavern of Souls to protect its creatures and Ancient Tomb to accelerate its mana. Additionally, it includes disruptive artifacts like Void Mirror and powerful spells like Swords to Plowshares to control the game. The deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in order to secure a victory in a Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with hate cards like Chancellor of the Annex, Archon of Emeria, and Void Mirror while deploying aggressive creatures like Seasoned Dungeoneer, Witch Enchanter, and White Plume Adventurer. It also has powerful mana acceleration with Moxen and Ancient Tomb to quickly get ahead and apply pressure. The inclusion of cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine ensures that the opponent's resources are limited, allowing the aggro strategy to overwhelm them. The deck aims to control the game tempo and win through efficient creature beats and disruptive plays.

The focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Treasure Cruise. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Force of Will to control the board, along with disruptive spells like Force of Negation and Spell Pierce to counter key spells. With the addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck gains additional value by being able to recast cheap permanents from the graveyard.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Wasteland to disrupt opponents' strategies and maintain board control. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value from the graveyard. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through efficient card selection, disruption, and resource denial, ultimately dominating the game with a strong Dimir Control strategy.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Doomsday and using cards like Gush, Street Wraith, and Gitaxian Probe to quickly cycle through the library to find and play Thassa's Oracle for the win. It also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. The deck aims to efficiently and decisively win the game by executing the Doomsday combo as quickly as possible while also being able to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a mana advantage through artifacts and lands, utilizing aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game while pressuring the opponent. Cards like Mystic Forge, Karn, the Great Creator, and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain provide powerful abilities to manipulate the board state and generate advantage. The deck aims to assemble combos such as Time Vault and Manifold Key to quickly close out games. With a mix of fast mana, disruptive elements, and powerful threats, this MUD Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory through resource efficiency and strategic plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements with cards like Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's strategy while using card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Ponder to maintain card advantage. It also includes powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen for ramp and mana fixing. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion gives the deck additional value by allowing you to recast creatures from the graveyard. The deck aims to control the game until it can establish a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent.

This deck relies on powerful artifact cards and land disruption to quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and stax effects. Mishra's Workshop provides an abundance of mana to cast threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Lodestone Golem early in the game. The deck contains various mana rocks and disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to control the game. Meanwhile, Wasteland and Strip Mine help to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while cards like Thorn of Amethyst and Sphere of Resistance slow down their spells. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive elements, this deck aims to establish dominance early on.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures known as Hatebears to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying pressure. It also includes mana acceleration through powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen to cast its threats quickly. With cards like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's spells and lock them out of the game. The inclusion of disruptive hate cards like Void Mirror and Cavern of Souls further adds to the deck's ability to control the game and secure victory through fast, aggressive plays.

The key concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gaining card advantage and controlling the board with counterspells, removal, and bounce effects. The deck aims to maintain control of the game through targeted disruption and resource management, using powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Demonic Tutor to maintain board presence and outvalue the opponent. By playing efficiently and leveraging its card advantage, the deck aims to grind out victories by overwhelming the opponent's resources and disrupting their strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to maintain control of the game by disrupting the opponent's plays and eliminating threats while utilizing powerful card draw and selection tools to stay ahead in the game. This control archetype focuses on utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption to keep the opponent on the back foot, while also leveraging powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Demonic Tutor to generate card advantage and access key pieces of the deck. The goal is to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent until victory is secured.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary cards to utilize the combo potential of Underworld Breach, generating infinite mana and storm count to ultimately win the game with Brain Freeze or another win condition. It includes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Black Lotus, and Time Walk to accelerate the combo, while also including disruption in the form of Pyroblast, Force of Will, and Mana Drain to protect the combo and disrupt opponents. The deck is streamlined to efficiently execute the combo while also having answers for opposing threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing the mechanics of discarding, dredging, and reanimating cards from the graveyard to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Hollow One, Ichorid, and Prized Amalgam. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to quickly fill the graveyard with key cards using effects like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Grief and Mindbreak Trap.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful artifact cards and lands to generate mana quickly, disrupt opponents' strategies with cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere, and deploy efficient threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Lodestone Golem to put pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures, disruptive artifacts, and resilient lands, creating a fast and powerful aggro strategy that can quickly take control of the game.
